TenUI::UIComponent

TenUI::UIComponent Class Reference

#include <UIComponent.h>

Inheritance diagram for TenUI::UIComponent:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

UIComponent is the basic build block of the UI controls and container that TenUI Applications use. UIComponent expands DisplayObjectContainer in the following ways:
  • Stateful
    • UIComponents (and subclasses) can define states and transitions to help maintain state
    • A UIComponent's always operate in one state at a time.
    • See also:
      StateMachine, State, Transition
  • Style
    • UIComponents are decorated by StyleSet (a set of styles).
    • UIComponents will have (atleast) a StyleSet for each state (see above).
    • This feature will grow into a more mature CSS Styling system.
      • See also:
        StyleSet, Style
  • User Ownership
    • UIComponents currently can be owned by one User, referred to by UserID given by a UserInput.
    • See also:
      UserInput
      UI controls and containers Defines virtual methods that subclasses must override
  • drawSelf()

UserID_Type TenUI::UIComponent::getOwnerUserID (  ) 

Gets the owner User ID of the owner.

Returns:
User ID of owner or UserInput::NO_USER_ID if no owner.

void TenUI::UIComponent::setOwnerUserID ( UserID_Type  newOwner  ) 

Sets the owner User ID of the owner.

Parameters:
newOwner User ID of new owner

void TenUI::UIComponent::clearOwnerUserID (  ) 

Makes the component unowned by any User. Effectively sets the owner User ID to UserInput::NO_USER_ID.

void TenUI::UIComponent::handleUserInputEvent ( const shared_ptr< UserInputEvent > &  uievent  )  [virtual]

Called by InputManager. Receives PointEvent and MultiPointEvents that pertain to this UIComponent. Redirects Events to all EventHandlers interested in the following event types:

  • MultiPoint Events
    • MULTIPOINT_EVENT_TYPE
  • Point Events
    • DOWN_EVENT_TYPE
    • UP_EVENT_TYPE
    • MOVE_EVENT_TYPE
    • IN_EVENT_TYPE
    • OUT_EVENT_TYPE

Todo:
